fields.summary: Allow the elements in the JIRA header to be hidden for anonymous users

fields.description:
The URL /secure/ReleaseNote.jspa?projectId=?? allows anonymous users to  view a Release Notes creation wizard displaying the project name and list of all available (released and unreleased) version of the project.

On Jira installation with private projects exposed on untrusted networks, sensitive informations are leaked.
fields.summary: Grant access to the Release Notes wizard only to users with Browse Project permission

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-34538].
  {panel}

I'm making an API request to the REST API to update an issue. The request looks like:
[:put,
 "/rest/api/2/issue/57638",
 "{\"update\":{\"fields\":{\"customfield_12250\":\"flexd\"},\"comment\":[{\"add\":{\"body\":\"test commit\"}}],\"transition\":{\"id\":751}}}",
 {"Accept"=>"application/json", "Content-Type"=>"application/json"}]

I get back a 400 response with the given body:
{"errorMessages":["Can not deserialize instance of java.util.ArrayList out of START_OBJECT token\n at [Source: org.apache.catalina.connector.CoyoteInputStream@28966bb8; line: 1, column: 12] (through reference chain: com.atlassian.jira.rest.v2.issue.IssueUpdateBean[\"update\"])"]}

When I send that comment on it's own, without associated other data things work
fields.summary: JSON parsing for API requests should handle single value lists
JIRA Importers source code policy

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-34536].
  {panel}

Starting in version 6, the (.) keyboard shortcut, "Find Actions", was greatly enhanced. The added items it matches are great, but I believe they're presented in the wrong order, in a way that negatively affects productivity.

The options should be presented in the order of "Workflow", "Issue Actions", and finally "Edit Fields".

Two use case examples:
   In Jira 5, .clo<enter> would select "close issue", while in 6 it now selects "clone". Close would seem to clearly be the more common action to take on an issue.
   In Jira 5, .ass<enter> would select the "Assign" issue action. In Jira 6 it matches the "Assignee" edit field, which is probably more insidious. Users may simply edit the field, since what they really want to accomplish is just that. They may not realize that the workflow associated with the ticket won't be triggered by going that route.
fields.summary: Change sort order of "Find actions" drop down

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-34533].
  {panel}

Hey [~rkrishna],

This looks pants: https://jira.atlassian.com/secure/BrowseProjects.jspa#all

We've got the same issue. Any chance you can add some word wrap to make that a little nicer?

While you're at it, any chance you can add the description and a search box so that people can search for things (in our case services the team owns which are listed in the Project Description field).

Small improvement, huge win for bigger instances.

Thanks,
Nick

PS - I would write this as user stories if they were available and you were using JAC for that. 

cc/ [~pslade]
fields.summary: Browse All Projects should wordwrap and include description

fields.description: {panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa} *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-34532]. {panel} On the newest OnDemand release, when exporting issues to Excel, the Status icon is displayed on the file, but broken. Up until last week it was displayed like: !previous_release.png! On this new release: !new_release.png! h3. Workaround: Modify tags manually on notepad: # Open file with notepad # Go to Edit -> Replace (Ctrl+H) #* Find: '
fields.summary: When doing an export from JIRA the report is inserting unwanted images.

fields.description:
The created and updated dates when view a list of issues in the issue search screen are incorrect.  If we view the incidents the dates are correct but the dates in the lists are incorrect.  See the attached screen shots.

This behavior occurred after a migration from 5.0.4 to 6.0.7.  Both an application upgrade and a DB migration occurred.  This issue did not exist in version 5.0.4
fields.summary: Issue Search Created and Updated Dates Incorrect

fields.description:
Please see the attached video and image to get an understanding of the issue.

Steps to reproduce:

- Have a list of issues in the assigned to me gadget where the summary is long enough that it will span two lines on resize of the window.
- resize the browser window until the footer disappear
fields.summary: Footer that displays number of issues in Assigned to me gadget disappears when resizing window
Add more operator available for Time Tracking field

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-34526].
  {panel}

It is currently not possible to compare customfield values, even if they are of the same type. For example, we have several customfields of Date type, and would like to search for issues with the JQL query:

customDate1 > customDate2

This although simple query is not possible in JIRA, and this is just terribly frustrating and ennoying.

Any chance to get it working some day?
fields.summary: Allow customfield comparisons
getDocumentTitle() function will always return the dialog title, although the dialog window is not opened

fields.description:
Steps to reproduce:
# Using a new installation of 6.0.6, set the cloners link descriptions as follows:
Outward Description: has clone
Inward Description: is clone of
\\
# Clone an issue with remote copy. The result is that the links are the wrong way around: the original appears with "is clone of" to the clone and the clone appears with "has clone" to the original. That is, the outbound link is created from the clone to the original and the inbound link the other way. This is the _opposite_ of the way the clone action creates links. Check this by creating a clone of the original issue with the normal clone action. The links appear as are opposite and that the remote copy clone and the clone clone appear in different link groups.
\\
# Now change the link descriptions back to preset:
Outward Description: is cloned by
Inward Description: clones
# Clone again. The result is that the links are now correct. That is, the outbound link is created from the original to the clone and the inbound link the other way. This is the same way the normal clone action creates links. You'll see that the new remote copy clone will appear in the same link group as the clone clone.
fields.summary: Warranty - JIRA to JIRA Copy Issue Plugin is referring to the wrong link description
Need Subcomponents
Issue Collector for multiple issue types
Provide a way to show parts of the custom field description only inside the admin interface.

Since we work on an incremental funding scheme, every feature (= JIRA issue) has its own ROI.
Tracking the hours with JIRA is a great help, however, we'd need to also keep track of external costs:
* External documentation costs
* Translation of the UI
* Special hardware
* etc
fields.summary: As a PM, I'd like to be able to book costs to a feature, not only man hours

fields.description:
When using OSX Mail.app I see attachments in the footer. I assume these are for the images in the content.

The problem is with how the MIME container for the email is constructed. It's possible to construct it in such a way that inline images _don't_ display as attachments. Confluence emails currently do this, I suggest comparing the source of confluence emails with a JIRA email to see the difference in how the images are included.
fields.summary: Icons in email notifications are shown as file attachments in Mail.app

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When attempting to create a project without authenticating as websudo first, it will fail and no error is presented in the browser.

h3. Steps to Reproduce

# Install JIRA 6.0.7.
# Login as an administrator user - do not get websudo access.
# Attempt to create a project.

h3. Expected Results

The project creation screen comes up without error.

h3. Actual Results

Nothing happens in the browser - JS errors are thrown in the console as per the attached screenshot.

h3. Workaround

This can be worked around with either of the following:

* Disable websudo as per our [Configuring Secure Administrator Sessions|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Configuring+Secure+Administrator+Sessions].
* Gain websudo access first by accessing a restricted area of JIRA before attempting to create the project (for example access {{Administration > System}}).
fields.summary: Create Project fails without error on JIRA 6.0.7

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-34511].
  {panel}

It seems that some dates/times are displayed relative to the current time rather than as a fixed date/time. 

It would be better if the actual date and time were displayed so that one doesn't have to calculate the actual date of a comment or other date.  For instance if someone wants to make reference to a prior comment made, if they mentioned "Please refer to my comment dated Last Friday 8:13 AM" it will become difficult to figure out once the date shows as the actual date after a month or whenever it ages out beyond the period to display as a relative date.

When I have issued a commitment date of when work will be done, I want to see the actual date.  I don't want to see that it's due in 4 days.

If someone desires to see relative date/time format it should be considered more of a user preference that could be configured.
fields.summary: Display actual dates/timestamps rather than relative
Create a auto-incrementing numeric field

fields.description: September have two days "7" and the month finish at Tuesday 30  !!!
fields.summary: September Calendar Error - Spanish

fields.description:
If a large list of version values contains entries such as

1b1
1b2
1b3
1b4
...
1bn
and also "1", it is impossible to select the value of "1" because it doesn't show up in the select list of possible values. 

h4. Workarounds
# Using *inline edit* from JIRA, simply type in the desired version and then click away from the field. You may receive an error, but the appropriate version should be listed. If there are duplicate or extra characters, simply clean that up and confirm the changes
# Manually sort the list of fixVersions in the Project Administration screen; the fixVersions at the bottom of the list will be at the top of the Picker. This will allow you to help ensure certain fixVersions are easy to find.
fields.summary: Cannot select version in a large list of similar values

fields.description:
Hello,

As stated in the forums, https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/192227/jira-drag-and-drop-attachments-plugin-should-not-be-active-for-ie-users-like-in-was-in-past-versions, the drag and drop utility is enabled for IE users after JIRA v6.  I've had to disable this great functionality.  For an IE user, he/she would try to drag a file on the "hotspot" and be prompted to open the file.  This is, of course, not the desired result and very confusing.

Please let me know if you need any more detail.

Thanks,
Steve
fields.summary: Disable Drag and Drop for unsupported browser versions

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-34490].
  {panel}

h3. Summary
Activity Stream Gadgets in Maximized Mode can be Edited

h3. Environment
* 6.5-OD-08-001

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# On a Dashboard (using System Dashboard as an Example) try to edit Activity Stream gadget (option to do it shouldn't be available).
!ActivityStream Default.png|thumbnail!
# Maximize gadget.
# Try to edit gadget - you should see the option and, after clicking it, edit form.
!ActivityStream Expanded.png|thumbnail!

h3. Expected Results
Gadget does not show Edit Menu after it is maximized

h3. Actual Results
When the Activity Monitor Gadget is maximized, the Edit menu is available to the user
 
h3. Notes
When user has no permissions to edit a dashboard there is no edit option in gadgets' menus. However when one maximizes a gadget the option appears and edit form can be filled out and sent. It's not being saved though there is no feedback to the user too.

h3.Workaround
fields.summary: Activity Streams gadget in maximized mode can be edited

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-34489].
  {panel}

Steps to reproduce:
1. Run clean JIRA instance, without home to get a creator
2. In creator set JIRA name to something different than default "Your Company JIRA"
3. Go to dashboard, Activity Stream gadget will be titled "Your Company JIRA" instead of proper value from the settings.
fields.summary: When installing JIRA, Activity Stream gadget's title is "Your Company JIRA" even if JIRA name is different

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-34486].
  {panel}

On a Dashboard with the Activity Stream gadget, maximising the gadget causes the gadget's title (e.g. "Your Company JIRA") to become corrupted by what looks like URL encoding (i.e. "Your+Company+JIRA").

Steps to reproduce:

# Create a new dashboard with *Start From* set to *System Dashboard*
# View the newly created dashboard
# Observe the title of the Activity Stream gadget: *Your Company JIRA*
# Maximise the gadget by hovering over its top bar and clicking the appropriate button
# Observe the title of the gadget is now corrupted: *Your+Company+JIRA*
fields.summary: Maximising the Activity Stream gadget corrupts the title

fields.description:
If I add a gadget of filter results, and then start typing to select a filter in the quick find edit box, The drop down with the matching filter results has a transparent background ,making it impossible to read the text.

This is only seen in IE8. However a percentage of our user base are locked to this browser

*Workaround*
* Click on the _Advanced Search_ link just below the text box, which will display a pop-up that will allow you to select the filter and enter it in the form.
fields.summary: Filter Results Gadget autocomplete filter selection textbox is broken by a transparent background
Ability to change which fields are duplicated with the 'create another' checkbox

fields.description:
Please see the following example:

# Point 1 containing {{(${entries.size()} issues)}} which is monospace macro
## Nested point 1
## Nested point 2 {{(${entries.size()} issues)}}

The nested list is broken because:
- the monoblock macro contains curly braces { }
- the monoblock macro contains dot (.)

We can workaround this problem by adding the escape character (backslash "\") to the inner curly braces:
# Point 1 containing {{($\{entries.size()\} issues)}}  which is monospace macro
## Nested point 1
## Nested point 2  {{($\{entries.size()\} issues)}}

It will be great if we can ensure that the nested list will still work even though if it contains some broken macro
fields.summary: JIRA wiki renderer: Nested list is not working when the monospace macro is broken

Dynamic detection of Date Time Picker in regards to the user's time zone

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-34473].
  {panel}

It appears that Axis does not provide any SOAP endpoints when JIRA is run behind https.  When one requests /rpc/soap, eg:

https://support.atlassian.com/rpc/soap/exec sp_prepexec @P1 output, N'@P1 bigint,@P2 bigint,@P3 nvarchar(4000),@P4 nvarchar(4000),@P5 nvarchar(4000),@P6 nvarchar(4000),@P7 datetime,@P8 decimal(38,0)', N'INSERT INTO jiraaction (ID, issueid, AUTHOR, actiontype, actionlevel, actionbody, CREATED, actionnum) VALUES (@P1 , @P2 , @P3 , @P4 , @P5 , @P6 , @P7 , @P8 )', 12823, 10549, N'neala', N'comment', NULL, N'The main problem is that ''smart'' quotes are really "dumb" because only MS Word knows about them.', 'Dec 31 2005 1:53:17:257PM', NULL



One gets back:

"""
And now... Some Services

    * null (wsdl)
"""

instead of the usual:

"""
And now... Some Services

    * null (wsdl)
          o getUser
          o createUser
          o getComponents
          o createGroup
          o getGroup
          o login
          o getServerInfo
          o updateGroup
"""

The WSDL is correspondingly empty.
fields.summary: SOAP does not work over HTTPS / SSL on certain configurations

fields.description:
A js error occurs from the chrome console:

GET http://ohernandez.dyn.syd.atlassian.com:8083/branch60/rest/project-templates/1.0/templates?_=1377241844349 401 (Unauthorized) batch.js:7
send batch.js:7
f.extend.ajax batch.js:7
loadProjectTemplatesData batch.js:1181
JPT.DialogControllerImpl.Class.extend.openWithSelectedProjectTemplate batch.js:1177
JPT.DialogControllerImpl.Class.extend.handleProjectTemplateTriggered batch.js:1177
JPT.DialogViewImpl.Backbone.View.extend._onClickAddProject batch.js:1179
f.event.dispatch batch.js:6
h.handle.i batch.js:6
Uncaught TypeError: Object #<Object> has no method '_enableWebSudo' batch.js:1177
(anonymous function) batch.js:1177
o batch.js:5
p.fireWith batch.js:5
w batch.js:7
d

*Workaround*

This can be worked around with either of the following:

* Disable websudo as per our [Configuring Secure Administrator Sessions|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Configuring+Secure+Administrator+Sessions].
* Gain websudo access first by accessing a restricted area of JIRA before attempting to create the project (for example access {{Administration > System}}).

- Currently, I used JIRA version v6.0.3#6099-sha1:c205478
 - When I want to add *Link* on issue, I can not added it, because the popup Add Link is very big, the action *Link* is hidden under bottom of browser. So, I can not click it for submit form Link.

Detail Step:
 + Open the JIRA site and add one issue.
 + After jira create, open this jira.
 + Click to action *More* on menu-bar and Click to action *Link* on menu-item. The popup *Link* display.
 Bug: 
   + The popup is very big can not see all actions on bottom of this popup.
Expectation:
   + Can support resize if popup is big and alway set position of popup is center of browser.
   + For all case, the action on bottom of this popup always displayed.

*Workaround*
Use full screen
Open the link dialog in a new browser tab

  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-34462].
  {panel}

Atlassian JIRA v6.0.2

I would like to show Web Links in a project Dashboard.  Currently, these are coming up blank on issues that have Web Links.

To reproduce:
Create an issue, add a Web Link to the issue. 
Create a dashboard, with Filter Results Gadget, enter a filter that will find the issue you just created and add "Linked Issues" in Fields to display.

My expectation is that i would at least see the Link Text in Dashboard Gadget.  Seems to work on other links "links to", "Mentioned in", "is duplicated by", etc...   Just not a Web Link.
fields.summary: Filter Results Gadget does not show Web Links

fields.description:
I've seen this twice now - on Jira 6.0.6, when I do a backup from our production server and restore to our sandbox server, I make sure "Disable Outgoing Mail" is checked, but after a restore, outgoing mail is not disabled, and our sandbox server is actually sending out emails. 

I just did another restore (from ms-sql in prod to postgres in the sandbox) and  outgoing email was still enabled, even though disable outgoing was checked.
fields.summary: Disable Outgoing Email on system restore not being honored

fields.description:
This is not supposed to happen:
{code}
2013-08-22 14:45:37,334 localhost-startStop-1 INFO      [atlassian.jira.startup.JiraStartupLogger] JIRA pre-database startup checks completed successfully.
2013-08-22 14:45:37,443 localhost-startStop-1 INFO      [jira.config.database.SystemTenantDatabaseConfigurationLoader] Reading database configuration from /Users/sorins/var/local/jira/dbconfig.xml
2013-08-22 14:45:37,503 localhost-startStop-1 INFO      [jira.config.database.DatabaseConfigurationManagerImpl] Now running Database Checklist Launcher
2013-08-22 14:45:38,218 localhost-startStop-1 INFO      [core.entity.jdbc.DatabaseUtil] Database Product Name is PostgreSQL
2013-08-22 14:45:38,218 localhost-startStop-1 INFO      [core.entity.jdbc.DatabaseUtil] Database Product Version is 9.2.4
2013-08-22 14:45:38,218 localhost-startStop-1 INFO      [core.entity.jdbc.DatabaseUtil] Database Driver Name is PostgreSQL Native Driver
2013-08-22 14:45:38,218 localhost-startStop-1 INFO      [core.entity.jdbc.DatabaseUtil] Database Driver Version is PostgreSQL 9.0 JDBC4 (build 801)
2013-08-22 14:45:38,574 localhost-startStop-1 WARN      [core.entity.jdbc.DatabaseUtil] Column "DELETED_EXTERNALLY" of table "public.cwd_user" of entity "User" exists in the database but has no corresponding field
2013-08-22 14:45:38,574 localhost-startStop-1 WARN      [core.entity.jdbc.DatabaseUtil] Entity "User" has 16 fields but table "public.cwd_user" has 17 columns.
2013-08-22 14:45:39,435 localhost-startStop-1 INFO      [atlassian.jira.startup.DatabaseChecklistLauncher] JIRA database startup checks completed successfully.
{code}

I checked the database and I do see the deleted_external column so I am not sure what is causing this WARN and if this will have any side effects but clearly, restarting Jira does not remote the warning.
fields.summary: Column "DELETED_EXTERNALLY" of table "public.cwd_user" of entity "User" exists in the database but has no corresponding field

fields.description:
We are recently having a problem with our JIRA ticketing. We should be around ticket number 490, but it appears recently that new tickets are getting created with old numbers (ie a new ticket came in yesterday as 452, but if user click the link it takes them to the old closed ticket -  Because of this JIRA ignores the email and doesn't create a new ticket - and the only record of the request happens to be in my inbox for some reason new tickets that are generated in for the projects are re-using old ticket numbers when users click on newly created tickets and open it in Jira it refers to a different ticket number (usually closed tickets).

JIRA version: Enterprise Edition, Version: 3.13-330

Thanks,
Syed
fields.summary: New tickets are getting created with old numbers

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-34449].
  {panel}

Please see the images:

!tinygraph.png|thumbnail! (Safari)
!chrome.png|thumbnail! (Chrome)

These are both on the same dashboard, one displayed in Chrome correctly, and the other is displayed in Safari.  This has been reproduced in Safari 5.1.9, still happening in 6.0.5.
fields.summary: Progress graphs are not displayed correctly within gadget in Safari
Configuring fields via email
configure
test
softwer

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-34440].
  {panel}

JIRA has different behaviour for how it renders custom field descriptions and options depending on if it's running BTF or on OnDemand.

* On OnDemand, custom field descriptions are wiki markup, but on BTF they're HTML.
* On OnDemand, custom field options (e.g. for checkbox) are plain text, but on BTF they're HTML.

I propose we make BTF behave the same as OnDemand. The rational is:

* The differing behaviour introduces development and support costs, and makes it more difficult for users transitioning BTF ⇿ OnDemand.
* Supporting HTML enables XSS attacks.
* Supporting HTML for options causes problems for other features, e.g. charts (see attachment)
fields.summary: Make custom field description and options rendering consistent for OnDemand and BTF

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-34439].
  {panel}

* {{issue =}} and {{issue in}} should never fail to validate because of the non-existance of issue keys or issue ids.
* {{issue = LITERAL}} and {{issue in (LITERALS...)}} should issue warnings to the user (not errors) if any of they keys/ids do not exist
* {{issue = someFunction()}} and {{issue in someFunction()}} should skip existence checking completely and not even issue warnings (this will improve performance).


NB JRA-34436 changed these JQL clauses to skip permission validation.
fields.summary: "issue =" and "issue in" should not fail to validate on unknown issues
il mio softwer
softwer

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-34436].
  {panel}

*Currently* when performing a {{issue in X}} search using JQL (where {{X}} could be a literal, or a function or anything else), {{X}} is validated to ensure it only contains existing issues the current user can see. If this validation fails, the whole JQL fails to validate and a search is not even run.

*After this change* validation-time checking on permissions is done in the {{issue in}} clause ONLY for non-function operands. However, at search-time the normal search process ensures that search results do not contain issues the user cannot see, regardless of the types of operands. If the issue does not exist, a validation error still occurs.

For example for {{issue in watchedIssues()}} and one of the issues that you've watched become unaccessible by you, where you would have previously seen a validation error, you will now see zero results.

*Currently* As part of the validation, permission to view the returned issues by the current user  is checked and any jql query that returns one or more issues that are not viewable by the current user will be considered invalid and the actual search will not happen.

In the happy path case, when the query passes validation, the search using the jql query will still perform another permission check to make sure that no issues that violate the permission constraints are returned to the user. So the same permission check is performed twice here, once during validation, another during search.

In addition, in jql functions (e.g., LinkedIssuesFunction) that return issue ids for the clauses like *issue in*, the function implementations have to perform their own permission check, in order to make sure that they return only valid issue ids to pass the jql validation. This in effect adds another round of permission check.

*After this change* Since jql functions are the main ones that might return a lot of issues, if we could get rid of the step of permission check in jql validation for {{issue in _some-jql-functions_}}, and rely only on the actual search to check permissions, we could eliminate up to two rounds of duplicated permission checks (one during jql validation, and potentially another one in the jql functions) for the majority of the jql search results.

Note that The relaxation of the permission check during validation time only applies to the potential search results. If the jql function accepts parameters that refer to issues, e.g., {{issue in linkedIssues("ABC-123")}}, it is still the responsibility of the jql function implementation to check the user's permissions to access ABC-123.
fields.summary: Skip view issue permission check during jql "issue in" validation for function operands

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-34434].
  {panel}

When adding an Issue Collector to any projects using Internet Explorer 10 (IE10), the 'Template Preview' is not rendered, and a warning message appears right below stating that:
{quote}
Issue Collectors will not record all the data submitted in the form, since the description and environment fields for the issue type are not present.
{quote}
(!) Apart from that, the Submit button is greyed out and unclickable.

*Steps to reproduce*:
# Using Internet Explorer 10, go to a project's administration view.
# Select 'Issue Collectors' on the left.
# Click the 'Add Issue Collector' button
# Scroll the page down until you see the 'Template Preview'

(i) This only happens in *IE10*. In IE8, IE9, IE11, Chrome, and Firefox, the 'Template Preview' is rendered correctly.

h3.Workaround:
# Use another browser
# If using IE10, switch Document Mode to IE9 Standards (while keeping Browser Mode as IE10)
fields.summary: Can't add Issue Collectors using Internet Explorer 10

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-34433].
  {panel}

JIRA has an amazing feature which allows users to get a snapshot of Issues to be sent via email periodically.

Unfortunately, the Subscription feature do not capture snapshots of issues( if issue count > 200). 

Ideally the Subscription feature should capture the snapshot of the filter(Issue-List) at the time the subscription email is sent. If the issue count is greater than 300, the link sent in the email should show the issue list and details at the time the subscription email was sent. If this is not achievable, it should atleast send the entire snapshot as an excel spreadsheet.

Feel free to term this as an enhancement/new feature.
fields.summary: JIRA Subscription do not capture snapshots in email when subscription email is sent.
Creation of new users during CSV import
softwer
earliestUnreleasedVersion() function includes archived Versions
Support "Epic Link Relationship" custom field on 2D Filter Statistics Gadget

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-34426].
  {panel}

h4.Current behavior

At the moment, it is not possible to clone issue if the workflow transition having *jira.issue.editable = false*. 

h4.Expected behavior

Clone issue operation should be separate from Edit issue operation. Hence it should make it possible to clone issue although the issue editable property is set to False.
fields.summary: Allow Clone operation on jira.issue.editable = false

fields.description:
Issue: 
When I view a Workflow, it appears in a suitably sized panel that I can zoom in about out of

When I edit a Workflow, the available panel shrinks vertically and makes it very hard to edit

Repro steps: Edit a workflow in diagram mode

Desired behavior is that panel is same size for editing as viewing (it used to be like this)

tried in Chrome, Firefox and IE
fields.summary: Issue with panel size when editing workflows
Attaching screenshots hoses the client PC when trying to attach more than one screenshot

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-34423].
  {panel}

{panel:title=Atlassian Update - 23 September 2016}
Hi everyone,

Suppressing email notifications is now possible when editing issues. We have added a new {{notifyUsers}} query parameter to the issue resource. You can set this query parameter value to {{false}} when making a PUT request to suppress email notifications for your change. [You can view the documentation here|https://docs.atlassian.com/jira/REST/cloud/#api/2/issue-editIssue].

This will *only* affect email notifications – changes will still be logged, added to the issue change history, events will still be sent to listeners, webhooks will still fire.

This is currently available in JIRA Cloud and was released in JIRA Server 7.2.

Regards,
Dave Meyer
JIRA Product Management
{panel}
REST api is supposed to replace XML/RPC and SOAP APIs which are already deprecated (and contains blocker bugs).

I am filing this as a bug because it is clearly a regression from using SOAP where you can skip sending notifications.

This bug makes maintenance via REST almost impossible due to the amount of emails it will send to the users.

Support suggested disabling email notifications while the scripts are running but that's not possible for two reasons: these are live systems used 24x7 and 2nd, these could be triggered at different times or scheduled to run periodially, it's not possible to disable email notifications for the entire instance just to prevent these from happening.

One possible solution to this problem is to have a special group, like jira-bots (or jira-automation, jira-silent) for which jira will skip sending email notifications if the changes were made by a user part of this group.
fields.summary: Add the ability to update issues via REST without sending notifications
Add ability to encode attachment to binary data via REST API

fields.description: After an upgrade from JIRA 6.0.2 to JIRA 6.0.6 the layout of the "Assigned To Me" gadget is not correct. I tested this with Firefox and Internet Explorer in different versions. Firefox and IE 10 show the expected layout but don't show all issues because the gadget height is too low. In IE 8 the layout is screwed completely (this version is not critical for me).
fields.summary: incorrect layout of "Assigned To Me" gadget

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-34419].
  {panel}

Dear support,

I'm writing to you because our company migrated to JIRA 6.0.4 last week. since this day I saw that the labels edition is less user friendly as the ancient version we get.

When you have already a label and you want to delete it/add another one, you have to go to more --> labels.

On the ancient version, you can edit directly this field, clicking on a pen, next to the labels.

I uploaded you a video showing you the issue on the new version, and the ancient version we used.

Best regards,
Jeremy
fields.summary: Label edition is not as user friendly as the ancient version

fields.description:
1. Start editing the description in Chrome Version 28.0.1500.95 and JIRA v6.1-m05-1#6138-sha1:f7d9654 
2. Add new content to the description
3. Start a search (Command / Control + F) and enter a keyword to search for something
4. Your unfinished edit is now submitted without confirmation
fields.summary: Search (Command + F) in Chrome while inline editing exits edit mode

fields.summary: Nothing happens when pressing 'Confirm' to upload a Profile Picture in JIRA
Issue status diff in emails should not be diffed word-for-word

fields.description:
{panel:title=Atlassian Update – 11-27-2018|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#ebf2f9|titleBGColor=#ebf2f9|bgColor=#ffffff}
Hello, everyone! This behavior is, as of Jira 7.12.3, considered expected behavior, and additionally found to be a duplicate of the issue [JRASERVER-62923|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-62923] Since that request has more traction and with the intention of having all the interest gathered in one place, we will be closing this request. and ask you to direct any further feedback to the request JRASERVER-62923].

Best regards,
René Chiquete - Atlassian Support.
{panel}
We removed issue type "story" from one of our projects, but this was the type used for an incoming mail handler.
Sending an email would still create tickets of type story (OK), whenever we transitioned them, they'd be converted to Epics (NOK).
fields.summary: Deleting an issue type does not check against Incoming Mail Handlers
Improve the display of comments where the author was the anonymous user

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-34412].
  {panel}

h4. Problem
A search via REST api call results in a high number of database queries, which could result in database performance issues.

h4. Testing:
I ran a local test:
* Enabled SQL Logging in JIRA
* Ran search via issue navigator (HTTP)
{code}
project = test
{code}
* confirm SQL logging
* Ran search via REST api
{code}
curl -D- -u admin:admin -X GET -H "Content-Type: application/json" http://localhost:8079/rest/api/2/search?jql=project=test > restsearch-output
{code}

Results:
* both HTTP and REST searches returned 50 issues (there are a total 1201, but only 50 are shown at a time)
* the 50 issues are all the same issue keys in both searchs
* HTTP - 45 SQL queries
** including checks/updates to userhistoryitem table, 12 queries
* REST - 413 SQL queries
** including auth for the user, 20 queries
** did not seem to check/update userhistoryitem

Edit:
* Just ran same test with com.atlassian.jira.issue.search.providers set to DEBUG
** HTTP - 5 lines of DEBUG logging
** REST - 77 lines of DEBUG logging
*** There seems to be extra queries relating to parenttasks.  I ran a quick check and there are 10 sub-tasks in the search results.
* see attached file
fields.summary: searching issues via REST results in a high number of database queries
